data.title: Rila Monastery
data.text: The Monastery of Saint John of Rila also known as Rila Monastery Sveti Ivan Rilski is the largest and most famous Eastern Orthodox monastery in Bulgaria It is situated in the southwestern Rila Mountains south of the capital Sofia in the deep valley of the Rilska River Rila River at an elevation of above sea level inside of Rila Monastery Nature Park The monastery is named after its founder the hermit Ivan of Rila 876 946 AD and houses around 60 monks Founded in the 10th century the Rila Monastery is regarded as one of Bulgaria s most important cultural historical and architectural monuments and is a key tourist attraction for both Bulgaria and Southern Europe In 2008 alone it attracted 900 000 visitors The monastery is depicted on the reverse of the 1 lev banknote issued in 1999
